018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
021
022import org.apiguardian.api.API;
023import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
024import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.TSIDImpl;
025
026/**
027 *  <p>{@summary The definition for a 64-bit time-based and time-sorted unique
028 *  id.}</p>
029 *  <p>The idea behind this implementation of a unique key is to have a shorter
030 *  version of a unique key as that provided by the class
031 *  {@link java.util.UUID}
032 *  with its 128-bit length.</p>
033 *  <p>In addition, the text representation of a TSID can also be used for XML
034 *  and HTML ids (an XML id may not begin with a digit).</p>
035 *  <p>A TSID has a 42-bit timestamp – the milliseconds since
036 *  {@value #BEGIN_OF_EPOCH}, a 12-bit counter (the number of ids that can be
037 *  created within the same millisecond), and a 10-bit node identifier. This
038 *  means that for a given node identifier no collision will happen before the
039 *  year 2160.</p>
040 *  <p>The node identifier can be set through a JVM command parameter named
041 *  {@value #PROPERTY_TSID_NODE}, or it can be given as an argument to the
042 *  factory method. If the property is not set, a random value will be
043 *  determined at program start.</p>
044 *
045 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
046 *  @version $Id: TSID.java 1076 2023-10-03 18:36:07Z tquadrat $
047 *  @since 0.1.0
048 *
049 *  @UMLGraph.link
050 *
051 *  @see UniqueIdUtils#newTSID()
052 *  @see UniqueIdUtils#newTSID(int)
053 *
054 *  @deprecated Do not use any longer! This is not tested!
055 */
056@SuppressWarnings( {"NewClassNamingConvention", "DeprecatedIsStillUsed"} )
057@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: TSID.java 1076 2023-10-03 18:36:07Z tquadrat $" )
058@API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.1.0" )
059@Deprecated( since = "0.3.0", forRemoval = true)
060public sealed interface TSID extends Comparable<TSID>
061    permits TSIDImpl
062{
063        /*-----------*\
064    ====** Constants **========================================================
065        \*-----------*/
066    /**
067     *  The start of the epoch for the TSIDs: {@value}.
068     */
069    public static final String BEGIN_OF_EPOCH = "2022-01-01T00:00:00.000Z";
070
071    /**
072     *  The maximum number of ids that can be generated per millisecond:
073     *  {@value}.
074     */
075    @SuppressWarnings( "StaticMethodOnlyUsedInOneClass" )
076    public static final int MAX_IDS_PER_MILLISECOND = 4096; // 12 bit
077
078    /**
079     *  The maximum number of distinguishable nodes for the TSID generation:
080     *  {@value}.
081     */
082    public static final int MAX_NODES = 1024; // 10 bit
083
084    /**
085     *  The property name for the node value that is used for the generation of
086     *  the ids: {@value}.
087     */
088    public static final String PROPERTY_TSID_NODE = "org.tquadrat.util.tsid.node";
089
090    /**
091     *  The length of a TSID String: {@value}.
092     */
093    public static final int TSID_Size = 14;
094
095        /*---------*\
096    ====** Methods **==========================================================
097        \*---------*/
098    /**
099     *  Returns the id as a {@code long} value.
100     *
101     *  @return The numeric value that represents this TSID instance.
102     */
103    public long asLong();
104
105    /**
106     *  {@inheritDoc}
107     */
108    @Override
109    public int compareTo( final TSID other );
110
111    /**
112     *  {@inheritDoc}
113     */
114    @Override
115    public boolean equals( final Object o );
116
117    /**
118     *  {@inheritDoc}
119     */
120    @Override
121    public int hashCode();
122
123    /**
124     *  <p>{@summary Returns a String representation for the TSID.} Basically,
125     *  this is the
126     *  {@link Base32}
127     *  format, using
128     *  {@href https://www.crockford.com/base32.html Crockfords's schema},
129     *  prefixed with the letter 'X'. The prefix allows to use the TSID also as
130     *  an XML id.</p>
131     */
132    @Override
133    public String toString();
134}
135//  interface TSID
136
137/*
138 *  End of File
139 */
